item.title: maricar add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description: "mankind is resilient: the atrocities that horrified us a week ago become acceptable tomorrow." -- Joseph Heller

item.title: maricar add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "But better to get hurt by the truth than comforted with a lie." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: maricar add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Man is sometimes extraordinarily, passionately, in love with suffering..." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: maricar add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "All extremes of feeling are allied with madness." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: maricar add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Nothing thicker than a knife's blade separates happiness from melancholy." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: maricar add a quote by Amy Tan
item.description: "If you can't change your fate, change your attitude." -- Amy Tan

item.title: maricar add a quote by Terry Brooks
item.description: "Hurt leads to bitterness, bitterness to anger, travel too far that road and the way is lost." -- Terry Brooks

item.title: maricar add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "True terror is to wake up one morning and discover that your high school class is running the country." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: maricar add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Those who believe in telekinetics, raise my hand." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: maricar add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "When you've suffered a great deal in life, each additional pain is both unbearable and trifling." -- Yann Martel

item.title: maricar add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Nothing can cure the soul but the senses, just as nothing can cure the senses but the soul." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: maricar add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description: "I want to keep my dreams, even bad ones, because without them, I might have nothing all night long." -- Joseph Heller

item.title: maricar add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I'm a kind of paranoiac in reverse. I suspect people of plotting to make me happy." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: maricar add a quote by Eoin Colfer
item.description: "Confidence is ignorance. If you're feeling cocky, it's because there's something you don't know." -- Eoin Colfer

item.title: maricar add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "A ruffled mind makes a restless pillow." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: maricar add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "I know a way to stay friends forever, There's really nothing to it, I tell you what to do, And you do it." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: maricar add a quote by Fyodor Dostoyevsky
item.description: "The greatest happiness is to know the source of unhappiness." -- Fyodor Dostoyevsky

item.title: maricar add a quote by Karen Marie Moning
item.description: "Yesterday is skin on snake, to be shed many times." -- Karen Marie Moning

item.title: maricar add a quote by Dodie Smith
item.description: "...I have noticed that when things happen in one's imaginings, they never happen in one's life, so I am curbing myself." -- Dodie Smith

item.title: maricar add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "If there was a God, he'd guide the winds, let them blow for me so that, with a tug of my string, I'd cut loose my pain, my longing." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: maricar add a quote by Norton Juster
item.description: "It's bad enough wasting time without killing it." -- Norton Juster

item.title: maricar add a quote by Steven Pressfield
item.description: "A cavalryman's horse should be smarter than he is. But the horse must never be allowed to know this." -- Steven Pressfield

item.title: maricar add a quote by Margaret George
item.description: "In my experience, there are two things that no one will admit to: having no sense of humor and being susceptible to flattery." -- Margaret George

item.title: maricar add a quote by Margaret George
item.description: "What is one person's diversion may be another's supreme test." -- Margaret George

item.title: maricar add a quote by Augusten Burroughs
item.description: "...handsome people are always interesting to watch. But a handsome person in crisis is riveting." -- Augusten Burroughs

item.title: maricar add a quote by Tony Bramwell
item.description: "Sometimes not knowing enough can allow you to think you can achieve anything." -- Tony Bramwell

item.title: maricar add a quote by Marian Keyes
item.description: "Why do we have such a finite capacity for pleasure but an infinite one for pain?" -- Marian Keyes

item.title: maricar add a quote by Marian Keyes
item.description: "How to make God laugh? Tell Him your plans." -- Marian Keyes

item.title: maricar add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "Try to be a filter, not a sponge." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: maricar add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "the juniors were acting different because they are now the seniors. They even had T-shirts made. I don't know who plans these things." -- Stephen Chbosky
